feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 5:28PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG WINDS AND HIGH SURF FOR THE KUSKOKWIM BAY COAST SUNDAY... An upper level disturbance will promote enhanced west to southwesterly winds early Sunday into Sunday afternoon. Sustained winds of 30 to 40 mph are forecast to overspread the Kuskokwim Bay and coast beginning Sunday morning. This timing is coincident with high tide. As a result, high surf 1 to 2 feet above the

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 3:58PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Cool And Wet Into Next Week... Northern Alaska is now in a cool and wet pattern that will last through next week. This will bring periods of snow to areas of the Interior above 3000 ft this weekend.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 3:55PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Through Saturday... Elevated surf will continue into Saturday. Northwest winds of 20 to 30 mph will continue into Saturday causing waves to wash up near the top of the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 3:55PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Along The Eastern Norton Sound Sunday Through Monday... Strong west winds Sunday into Monday are expected to cause elevated surf along the Norton Sounds Coast Sunday into Monday. Waves to wash near the top of the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 3:55PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Along the Yukon Delta Coast Tonight And Again Saturday Night Through Monday... Strong Northwest winds tonight are expected to cause elevated surf tonight along the Yukon Delta. The winds and surf will diminish on Saturday, and then increase again Saturday night into Sunday and continue into Monday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 3:49PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ....Elevated Surf Through Tonight... Elevated surf will continue through tonight. North winds of 20 to 25 mph will diminish tonight. This will cause waves to wash near the top of the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 3:49PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Through Saturday... Elevated surf will continue into Saturday. Winds will become northwesterly late today and increase to 20 to 30 mph tonight into Saturday. This will cause waves to wash near the top of the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 3:49PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Winds Saturday... West winds will increase on Saturday, with gusts to 50 mph Saturday and Saturday night.

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued August 05 at 3:45PM AKDT until August 07 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM SATURDAY TO 4 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 8 inches are possible above 3000 feet, with 2 to 4 inches from 2000 to 3000 feet. * WHERE...Northeastern Brooks Range above 2000 feet.

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued August 05 at 3:43PM AKDT until August 07 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SATURDAY TO NOON AKDT SUNDAY... * LOCATION...Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast. * TIMING...From 6 AM Saturday until Noon Sunday. * IMPACTS...Beach erosion will occur. Belongings left on the beach may wash away. Logs and debris will wash up on to the

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 12:37PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAIN THROUGH SATURDAY... An atmospheric river is affecting the northern half of Southeast Alaska. This system will produce heavy rain along with gusty winds, particularly Friday night through Saturday afternoon. 48 hours storm total rainfall is expected to be 1 to 3 inches, and up to 4 inches near Pelican.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 8:56PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG POSSIBLE NEAR THE LAKESHORE... Dense fog was moving inland from Lake Michigan this evening. It could make for hazardous travel on Lakeshore Drive and possibly highway 42. Slow down and use caution if you encounter fog.
